body: Calculate the equivalent resistance through a system of 2 resistors with resistances of 6 and 12 ohms in parallel.

A mass of 10 kilograms traveling 3 meters per second east collides perfectly elastically with a mass of 5 kilograms traveling 4 meters per second north. What is the total kinetic energy of the system following the collision, in joules?
By name or number, order the following 4 intermolecular forces from STRONGEST to WEAKEST: 1) dipole-dipole; 2) London dispersion; 3) ion-dipole; 4) hydrogen bonding.
By name or number, identify all of the following 3 molecules that exhibit resonance: 1) $\athrm{NO}_3^-$ ; 2) $\athrm{NO}_2^-$ ; 3) $\athrm{CO}_3^-$ ; 4) $\athrm{CO}_2$
Which of the following is closest to the wavelengths of light absorbed by photosystems 1 and 2, respectively?
Kary Mullis developed what laboratory technique which repeatedly copies a specific DNA segment?
Which planets have the MOST and LEAST eccentric orbits, respectively?
answer: MERCURY AND VENUS (MUST BE IN THAT ORDER)

body: Given that earth’s sidereal year is 365.256 days, to the nearest thousandth, how many times does earth rotate about its axis in one sidereal year?
What is the largest value of x such that $\athrm{x}^{2} + 2\athrm{x} + 1$ is less than or equal to 144?
Convert 10,000 in base 2020 to base 2019.
answer: ONE- FOUR- SIX- FOUR- ONE (DO NOT ACCEPT: 14,641)

body: A mass is being spun horizontally on a frictionless surface at a constant tangential velocity by a massless and unstretchable rod rotating about one end. If the rod doubles in length and the mass maintains its tangential velocity, by what factor is the tension on the rod multiplied?

A ball is dropped from a height of 200 meters at the same time that another ball is thrown up from the ground with an initial velocity of 50 meters per second. Giving your answer in seconds to the nearest tenth, how long will it take for the two balls to reach the same height?
Which of the following elements is most likely to violate the Aufbau principle?
How many hydrogens are in 2,4,6-trimethylheptane?
To what cellular structure does the COPII complex transport proteins?

In a species, red eyes are dominant to white eyes and long wings are dominant to short wings. A male that is heterozygous for both genes mates with a female that is homozygous recessive for both genes. Out of the offspring, there were 9 with red eyes and long wings, 3 with red eyes and short wings, 3 with white eyes and long wings, and 1 with white eyes and short wings. Calculate the recombination frequency, to the nearest percent.
What calcium carbonate polymorph has an orthorhombic unit cell?

By number, identify all of the following 3 statements that are true of seafloor spreading: 1) seafloor spreading usually occurs at convergent boundaries, 2) the newest seafloor is usually near coastlines, 3) the seafloor doesn’t actually spread because it’s the landmasses that move.
Compute the definite integral from 10 to 13 of $2x$ dx.
Compute the sum from n equals 1 to 2020 of the fraction with numerator 1 and denominator $n^2 + n$ .
The angle between two ideal polarizers is $60^{\irc}$ . By what factor does the intensity of the light passing through the two polarizers multiplied if the angle is changed to $30^{\irc}$ ?

Two waves of the same amplitude and period interfere with each other. One of the original waves is t/4 seconds behind the other. What is the ratio between the amplitude of the new wave and the amplitude of the original waves?
What is the formal charge of the nitrogen atom in ammonia?
By number, order the following 3 substances from LEAST to GREATEST van’t Hoff factor in water: 1) $\athrm{H}_{2}\athrm{O}$ ; 2) HCl; 3) $\athrm{H}_{3}\athrm{PO}_{4}$ .
What positively charged proteins contain many lysine and arginine residues and are where DNA wraps itself?
What was the first multicellular organism to have its entire genome sequenced?
Which of the following statements about the Pleistocene epoch is NOT true?

choices.W: It is contained within the Quaternary period
choices.X: It was the first epoch where humans appeared
choices.Y: The average temperature was much colder than today’s average temperatures
choices.Z: It was immediately preceded by the Paleocene epoch

answer: Z) IT WAS IMMEDIATELY PRECEDED BY THE PALEOCENE EPOCH

body: What era precedes the most recent era and is when Pangaea started to break up?

By number, identify all of the following 4 statements that are true of the polynomial $\athrm{x}^{3} + 3\athrm{x}^{2} + 3\athrm{x} + 1$ : 1) It is a depressed cubic; 2) It has no multiple roots; 3) It is concave down at $\athrm{x} = 0$ ; 4) Its third derivative is 0.
Compute the determinant of a 2020 by 2020 matrix with all entries equal to 1.
Find the velocity of a free-falling object after it has fallen 4.9 meters after being dropped from rest, given that acceleration due to gravity is $9.8 \athrm{~m} \dot \athrm{s}^{-2}$ .
Order the following three flavors of quarks from LEAST to MOST massive: 1) Charm; 2) Top; 3) Up.
What is the term for a molecule which has at least one positively charged functional group and one negatively charged functional group, but has an overall charge of zero?
From smallest to largest binding energy, the photoelectron spectroscopy spectrum of a neutral element has peaks of amplitudes 4 units, 4 units, 8 units. What element is this?
Ferredoxins are defined as having what two elements?
answer: IRON AND SULFUR (ACCEPT: SULFUR AND IRON)

body: By number order the following 5 skin layers from innermost to outermost: 1) stratum basale; 2) stratum corneum; 3) stratum granulosum; 4) stratum lucidum; 5) stratum spinosum.
During which of the following months is the Cancer constellation most visible from the Northern hemisphere?
What mineral is the chief source of chromium?
Compute $\athrm{e}^{0.5\athrm{i}}$ .
Compute the area of a cyclic quadrilateral with sides 7, 15, 20, 24, in that order.
